HOSPITAL & PHYSICIAN BILLING SPECIALIST
Professional Summary
HIGHLY-ORGANIZED PROFESSIONAL WHO EXCELS AT ASSISTING HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS WITH BILLING MANAGEMENT & CODING SUPPORT.
WELL-ROUNDED TEAM PLAYER WITH A STRONG TRACK RECORD OF WORKING IN COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENTS, AND DRIVING BOTTOM LINE GROWTH THROUGH REDUCING OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES.
EXCELLENT COMMUNICATOR AND FREELANCE HEALTHCARE MARKETING CONSULTANT WHO EXCELS AT ESTABLISHING A RAPPORT WITH CLIENTS FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS.
PROBLEM SOLVER WHO EXERCISES CRITICAL THINKING, AND PERFORMS WORK AHEAD OF SCHEDULE.
SEEKS TO TRANSITION INTO A MANAGEMENT ROLE WITH A PHYSICIAN'S OFFICE THAT WILL UTILIZE THE TALENTS/SKILLS OF AN EXPERIENCED MEDICAL BILLING SPECIALIST, AND ASPIRING OFFICE MANAGER.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Program Manager, Provider Experience

Location: Nashville Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Summary: 

The Program Manager, Provider Experience is a critical member of the HR team and is responsible for supporting ArchWell Health’s providers as they transition through the colleague life cycle. This role requires strong program and project management skills, attention to detail, strategic prioritization, and the confidence to communicate and drive accountability with cross-functional stakeholders of all levels. This role is integral to advancing and driving provider processes for a rapidly scaling multi-state medical group.

 Duties/Responsibilities: 

 Drive project management of provider onboarding and offboarding processes, ensuring accountability for delivery from cross-functional stakeholders  Develop and own a visible, centralized system of record for tracking the various workstreams involved in the provider onboarding and offboarding processes  Support process improvement and automation opportunities in alignment with provider talent strategy objectives  Collect and analyze data about providers’ colleague experience to identify opportunities for improvement and retention, build project plans, and drive them to completion  Partner with HR leadership to identify and deploy projects aimed to increase job enrichment and retention  Assist with maintenance of legal documents and provider records pertaining to the employee life cycle  Coordinate onboarding schedules, and the ordering of lab coats, business cards, and other provider onboarding materials to create a white glove experience as providers enter the organization  Partner with HR Operations and Learning & Development to ensure providers are assigned the correct training modules, and track their completion during the onboarding process  Provide direct support to providers and clinical leaders navigating processes pertaining to the employee life cycle (onboarding, offboarding, location and role changes, and promotional opportunities)  Recognize potential risks in provider onboarding and offboarding processes and implement proactive solutions  Additional projects as assigned 

 Required Skills/Abilities: 

 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail  Ability to define problems and identify optimal solutions under tight deadlines  Ability to manage and deliver strategic projects, communicate project status and risks to stakeholders  Flexible, “find a way” mindset to achieve deadlines while maintaining a positive attitude  Self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills with all levels of leadership  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite 

 Education and Experience: 

 Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent experience  Minimum of three years (4) of project management, program coordination or similar experience strongly preferred  Experience influencing and partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to drive accountability and adherence to deadlines  Experience coordinating complex calendars and schedules under a tight timeline  Experience partnering with providers preferred 

 About ArchWell Health: 

At ArchWell Health, we’re creating a community of caring designed to help our members stay healthy and engaged. By focusing on a strong provider-patient relationship, routine wellness, and staying active, our members enjoy a higher level of care and better quality of life after the age of 60. Everything we do is for seniors. We believe seniors should be heard, listened to, and given ample time by their physicians to live well later in life.

Our value-based care model is designed to prevent illnesses while keeping members healthy and happy in every aspect of their life. We deliver best-in-class primary care at comfortable, accessible neighborhood centers where older adults can feel at home and become part of a vibrant, wellness-focused community. We’re passionate about caring for older adults and united by the belief that caring has the power to change everything for our members.

ArchWell Health is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected classification.

Apply Now

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
